<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a node that has been visited to a pair (IsInvalid, BitWidth) where</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  \\c IsInvalid is true iff the node is invalid.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  \\c BitWidth, if non-zero, is the bitwidth of the integer used to denoting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    the offset of the access.  If zero, only a zero offset is allowed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\c BitWidth has no meaning if \\c IsInvalid is true.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Check a module for errors.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If there are no errors, the function returns false. If an error is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// found, a message describing the error is written to OS (if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// non-null) and true is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\return true if the module is broken. If BrokenDebugInfo is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">/// supplied, DebugInfo verification failures won&#39;t be considered as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">/// error and instead &#42;BrokenDebugInfo will be set to true. Debug</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">/// info errors can be &quot;recovered&quot; from by stripping the debug info.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Create a verifier pass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Check a module or function for validity. This is essentially a pass wrapped</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// around the above verifyFunction and verifyModule routines and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">/// functionality. When the pass detects a verification error it is always</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">/// printed to stderr, and by default they are fatal. You can override that by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">/// passing \\c false to \\p FatalErrors.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that this creates a pass suitable for the legacy pass manager. It has</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">/// nothing to do with \\c VerifierPass.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/verifierpass"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/verifierpass/#afdfa087b5d970e456095d7c0bad144fa">VerifierPass</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/passinfomixin">PassInfoMixin</a>&lt;VerifierPass&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FatalErrors;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/verifierpass/#afdfa087b5d970e456095d7c0bad144fa"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">explicit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/verifierpass/#afdfa087b5d970e456095d7c0bad144fa">VerifierPass</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FatalErrors = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) : FatalErrors(FatalErrors) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
